sen.j: 華道家（かどうか）とは、花をいける人。
sen.e: A Kado-ka is a person who arranges flowers.
A Kado-ka is a person who arranges flowers.
A Kado-ka is a person who arranges flowers.

sen.j: 花や植物そのものを用いた彫刻・造形をする人のことをさす。
sen.e: Specifically, it is a person who uses flowers and plants to produce sculptures or formative designs.
Specifically, a Kado-ka refers to a professional who produces sculptures and plastic figures made of flowers and plants.
Specifically, a Kado-ka refers to a professional who produces sculptures and designs made of flowers and plants.
sen.cmt: 「造形」"plastic figures" をfigureとしました。

sen.j: フラワーアーティスト、いけばな作家、挿花家、花師、等とも呼ばれることがある。
sen.e: A Kado-ka is also known as a flower artist, an ikebana sakka (flower arrangement artist), a soka-ka (also a flower arrangement artist), a hana-shi (flower professional) and so on.
A Kado-ka is sometimes called "flower artist,""Ikebana-sakka," "Soka-ka,"or"Hana-shi."
sen.cmt: 説明のカッコ書きをはずしました。
sen.e: A Kado-ka is sometimes called "flower artist,""Ikebana-sakka," "Soka-ka,"or"Hana-shi."

sen.j: また、彫刻家を兼ねることもある。
sen.e: Some of them double as sculptors.
Some of them are sculptors as well.
Some of them are sculptors as well.
